questions.question: What condition must be satisfied for an immittance function to represent a passive physical system?

answers.a: Must have all poles in the right-half s-plan
answers.c: Must be a positive real function
answers.d: Must have more zeros than poles

explanations.c: Passive systems require positive real functions, ensuring passivity, stability, and realizability.

questions.question: The number of poles and zeroes of a rational immittance function is determined by

answers.a: The degree of the numerator only
answers.b: The degree of the denominator only
answers.c: The degrees of both numerator and denominator
answers.d: The number of energy storage elements only

explanations.c: The degrees of both numerator and denominator

questions.question: What is an immittance function in electrical network analysis?

answers.a: The ratio of voltage to power
answers.b: The ratio of impedance to admittance
answers.c: Either impedance or admittance function of a network
answers.d: The sum of impedance and admittance

explanations.c: : Immittance is a general term that refers to either impedance (Z) or admittance (Y).

questions.question: poles of an immittance function are associated with

answers.b: Natural frequencies or resonances of the system
answers.d: Points where the function is zero

explanations.b: Poles are values of frequency where the function goes to infinityâ€”this happens at natural frequencies where the system resonates.

questions.question: The zeroes of an immittance function occur at:

answers.a: Points where the function goes to infinity
answers.c: Frequencies where the function value is zero
answers.d: Points where the phase angle is 180 degrees

explanations.c: A zero of a function is a frequency where the value of the function becomes zero
